title: July & August: Campaign Imagery
description: Develop the visual identity of your campaign through logos, signs, T-shirts, and other materials. Align visuals with your slogan and mission from Module 4.
readingSummary: Campaign imagery communicates professionalism, values, and energy.
1. Consistency → Fonts, colors, slogans, and images should reinforce your campaign identity.
2. Clarity → Signs and materials must be easily readable and memorable.
3. Authenticity → Images should feel genuine and aligned with your values.
Examples of campaign materials: Logo, yard signs, T-shirts/buttons, digital graphics.

tasks.prompt: Upload your primary campaign logo or describe it in typed format.
Upload a yard sign or poster design or describe it.
Upload a T-shirt or button design or describe it.
Optional bonus: Upload additional creative materials (stickers, social media graphics, etc.)
Scenario – Endorsement Dilemma: Decide whether to accept or decline an endorsement from 'Texas Mothers for Does' and explain your reasoning (1–2 paragraphs).
Scenario – Petition Decision: Decide whether to sign the petition 'End War in Gaza' and explain your reasoning (1 paragraph).
Scenario – Legislative Response: Respond to controversial legislation with a 3–5 paragraph statement, reflecting your campaign identity and messaging.

purpose: Develop the visual identity of your campaign and demonstrate strategic decision-making through scenarios that test alignment with campaign values.

scenarios.title: Endorsement Dilemma
scenarios.description: Decide whether to accept or decline an endorsement from a small advocacy group and explain your reasoning. AI evaluates strategic thinking and alignment with campaign identity.

scenarios.title: Petition Decision
scenarios.description: Decide whether to sign a petition ('End War in Gaza') and explain reasoning. AI evaluates clarity, consistency with values, and public messaging impact.

scenarios.title: Legislative Response
scenarios.description: Craft a public response to controversial legislation, 3–5 paragraphs, reflecting campaign identity and persuasive clarity. AI evaluates alignment with mission.

outcome.description: Campaign visuals uploaded or explained and evaluated. CC updated based on design quality and scenario responses. Voter approval adjusted based on endorsement, petition, and legislative response.
